title: 107_hr1586
content: The Act may be cited as the "FERS Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Buyback Act of 2001". It addresses the creditability of service. The FERS Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Buyback Act of 2001 amends Section 8411(b) of title 5, United States Code to include service as a temporary or intermittent employee for the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation performed between December 31, 1988, and January 1, 2001, of at least 1 year's duration, if the individual later becomes subject to this chapter. An employee or Member must deposit 1.3 percent of basic pay for service performed as a temporary or intermittent employee for the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation. Deposits made more than 5 years later must include interest. The deposit is due with interest computed and compounded annually after 5 years. If the full deposit is not made, service is creditable but annuity may be reduced. SEC. 3. PROVISIONS RELATING TO PERSONS WHO HAVE SEPARATED. The Office of Personnel Management will prescribe regulations for obtaining credit for service performed by individuals who have separated from Government service. Credit will only be given upon submission of a written application by December 31, 2001. Any annuity or survivor annuity will be recomputed to include the service described in the regulations. The Office of Personnel Management will prescribe regulations for obtaining credit for service performed by individuals who have separated from Government service. Credit will only be given upon submission of a written application by December 31, 2001. If the full deposit required under section 8411(k) of title 5 is not timely made, a reduction will be made in the recomputed annuity. Interest is not included in the deposit. The Office of Personnel Management will notify individuals of their rights under the Act and assist in obtaining necessary information from the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation. The Corporation will provide information on an individual's service upon request from the Office.
